coordinateSystem.description: Base number of coordinate system (0 for 0-based numbering or coordinates, inclusive start, exclusive end, 1 for 1-based numbering, inclusive start, inclusive end)

identifier.description: Unique ID for this particular sequence. This is a FHIR-defined id

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

patient.description: Who and/or what this is about

performer.description: Who should be responsible for test result

quality.description: An set of value as quality of sequence

quantity.description: The number of copies of the sequence of interest.  (RNASeq)

readCoverage.description: Average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence

repository.description: External repository which contains detailed report related with observedSeq in this resource

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

gtFP.description: False positives where the non-REF alleles in the Truth and Query Call Sets match

queryTP.description: True positives from the perspective of the query data

truthTP.description: True positives from the perspective of the truth data

genomeBuild.description: The Genome Build used for reference, following GRCh build versions e.g. 'GRCh 37'

referenceSeqPointer.description: A pointer to another MolecularSequence entity as reference sequence

referenceSeqString.description: A string to represent reference sequence

windowEnd.description: End position of the window on the reference sequence

windowStart.description: Start position of the window on the  reference sequence

datasetId.description: Id of the dataset that used to call for dataset in repository

variantsetId.description: Id of the variantset that used to call for variantset in repository

exact.description: Does the structural variant have base pair resolution breakpoints?

cigar.description: Extended CIGAR string for aligning the sequence with reference bases

end.description: End position of the variant on the reference sequence

start.description: Start position of the variant on the  reference sequence

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

url.description: identifies the meaning of the extension

assigner.description: Organization that issued id (may be just text)

period.description: Time period when id is/was valid for use

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

use.description: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)

lastUpdated.description: When the resource version last changed

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

system.description: System that defines coded unit form

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

coding.description: Code defined by a terminology system

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

country.description: Country (e.g. can be ISO 3166 2 or 3 letter code)

line.description: Street name, number, direction & P.O. Box etc.

period.description: Time period when address was/is in use

use.description: home | work | temp | old | billing - purpose of this address

contentType.description: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.

size.description: Number of bytes of content (if url provided)

title.description: Label to display in place of the data

url.description: Uri where the data can be found

name.description: Name of an individual to contact

telecom.description: Contact details for individual or organization

period.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use

rank.description: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)

system.description: phone | fax | email | pager | url | sms | other

use.description: home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point

mustSupport.description: Indicates specific structure elements that are referenced by the knowledge module

profile.description: The profile of the required data

type.description: The type of the required data

description.description: Natural language description of the condition

name.description: Short name assigned to expression for reuse

given.description: Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names

period.description: Time period when name was/is in use

prefix.description: Parts that come before the name

suffix.description: Parts that come after the name

text.description: Text representation of the full name

use.description: usual | official | temp | nickname | anonymous | old | maiden

documentation.description: A brief description of the parameter

name.description: Name used to access the parameter value

profile.description: What profile the value is expected to be

display.description: Brief description of the related artifact

type.description: documentation | justification | citation | predecessor | successor | derived-from | depends-on | composed-of

url.description: Where the artifact can be accessed

dimensions.description: Number of sample points at each time point

factor.description: Multiply data by this before adding to origin

data.description: The actual signature content (XML DigSig. JWS, picture, etc.)

sigFormat.description: The technical format of the signature

targetFormat.description: The technical format of the signed resources

type.description: Indication of the reason the entity signed the object(s)

name.description: Name or URI that identifies the event

type.description: named-event | periodic | data-changed | data-added | data-modified | data-removed | data-accessed | data-access-ended

path.description: A code-valued attribute to filter on

searchParam.description: A coded (token) parameter to search on

path.description: A date-valued attribute to filter on

searchParam.description: A date valued parameter to search on

path.description: The name of the attribute to perform the sort

type.description: The kind of dose or rate specified

countMax.description: Maximum number of times to repeat

dayOfWeek.description: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun

durationUnit.description: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)

frequency.description: Event occurs frequency times per period

frequencyMax.description: Event occurs up to frequencyMax times per period

period.description: Event occurs frequency times per period

periodUnit.description: s | min | h | d | wk | mo | a - unit of time (UCUM)

when.description: Code for time period of occurrence

text.div:
Generated Narrative with Details

id: example

type: dna

coordinateSystem: 0

patient: Patient/example

*2212550322125504CG

*openapihttp://grch37.rest.ensembl.org/ga4gh/variants/3:rs1333049?content-type=application/jsonGA4GH API3:rs1333049

parameters.name: chromosome
parameters.description: Chromosome number of the reference sequence

parameters.name: chromosome-variant-coordinate
parameters.description: Search parameter by chromosome and variant coordinate. This will refer to part of a locus or part of a gene where search region will be represented in 1-based system. Since the coordinateSystem can either be 0-based or 1-based, this search query will include the result of both coordinateSystem that contains the equivalent segment of the gene or whole genome sequence. For example, a search for sequence can be represented as `chromosome-variant-coordinate=1$lt345$gt123`, this means it will search for the MolecularSequence resource with variants on chromosome 1 and with position >123 and <345, where in 1-based system resource, all strings within region 1:124-344 will be revealed, while in 0-based system resource, all strings within region 1:123-344 will be revealed. You may want to check detail about 0-based v.s. 1-based above.

parameters.name: chromosome-window-coordinate
parameters.description: Search parameter by chromosome and window. This will refer to part of a locus or part of a gene where search region will be represented in 1-based system. Since the coordinateSystem can either be 0-based or 1-based, this search query will include the result of both coordinateSystem that contains the equivalent segment of the gene or whole genome sequence. For example, a search for sequence can be represented as `chromosome-window-coordinate=1$lt345$gt123`, this means it will search for the MolecularSequence resource with a window on chromosome 1 and with position >123 and <345, where in 1-based system resource, all strings within region 1:124-344 will be revealed, while in 0-based system resource, all strings within region 1:123-344 will be revealed. You may want to check detail about 0-based v.s. 1-based above.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The entity that caused the expenses

parameters.name: referenceseqid-variant-coordinate
parameters.description: Search parameter by reference sequence and variant coordinate. This will refer to part of a locus or part of a gene where search region will be represented in 1-based system. Since the coordinateSystem can either be 0-based or 1-based, this search query will include the result of both coordinateSystem that contains the equivalent segment of the gene or whole genome sequence. For example, a search for sequence can be represented as `referenceSeqId-variant-coordinate=NC_000001.11$lt345$gt123`, this means it will search for the MolecularSequence resource with variants on NC_000001.11 and with position >123 and <345, where in 1-based system resource, all strings within region NC_000001.11:124-344 will be revealed, while in 0-based system resource, all strings within region NC_000001.11:123-344 will be revealed. You may want to check detail about 0-based v.s. 1-based above.

parameters.name: referenceseqid-window-coordinate
parameters.description: Search parameter by reference sequence and window. This will refer to part of a locus or part of a gene where search region will be represented in 1-based system. Since the coordinateSystem can either be 0-based or 1-based, this search query will include the result of both coordinateSystem that contains the equivalent segment of the gene or whole genome sequence. For example, a search for sequence can be represented as `referenceSeqId-window-coordinate=NC_000001.11$lt345$gt123`, this means it will search for the MolecularSequence resource with a window on NC_000001.11 and with position >123 and <345, where in 1-based system resource, all strings within region NC_000001.11:124-344 will be revealed, while in 0-based system resource, all strings within region NC_000001.11:123-344 will be revealed. You may want to check detail about 0-based v.s. 1-based above.

parameters.name: variant-end
parameters.description: End position (0-based exclusive, which menas the acid at this position will not be included, 1-based inclusive, which means the acid at this position will be included) of the variant.

parameters.name: variant-start
parameters.description: Start position (0-based inclusive, 1-based inclusive, that means the nucleic acid or amino acid at this position will be included) of the variant.

parameters.name: window-end
parameters.description: End position (0-based exclusive, which menas the acid at this position will not be included, 1-based inclusive, which means the acid at this position will be included) of the reference sequence.

parameters.name: window-start
parameters.description: Start position (0-based inclusive, 1-based inclusive, that means the nucleic acid or amino acid at this position will be included) of the reference sequence.
